Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Sherd
Description: Sherd of a typical Old Kerma bowl. The clay is very fine and black. The surfaces have been polished brick-red outside and beige inside. There is a carefully executed incised decoration below the lip consisting of alternating horizontal lines and diamonds filled with hatching. A carinated bowl with restricted mouth, this beautiful vessel is characteristic of the Old Kerma period.
